text: Bertha Hernández de Ospina (April 17, 1907 — September 11, 1993) was a Colombian writer, columnist, politician and suffragette served as first lady of Colombia from 1946 to 1950 as the wife of Mariano Ospina Pérez and more later as Senator of Colombia from 1970 to 1982. As first lady she led the suffrage movement in Colombia and later became the first woman director of a political party in Colombia. ==References== Category:1907 births Category:1993 deaths Category:First Ladies of Colombia Category:People from Medellín Category:Colombian politicians Category:Colombian writers
